abstract: This week, Google took another step toward bringing its popular Web tools onto a myriad of nontraditional computing devices, like tablet computers, when it acquired a mysterious Silicon Valley start-up called Agnilux.
snippet: This week, Google took another step toward bringing its popular Web tools onto a myriad of nontraditional computing devices, like tablet computers, when it acquired a mysterious Silicon Valley start-up called Agnilux.
lead_paragraph: From Brad Stone and Ashlee Vance at Bits:

headline.main: Google Acquires Another Piece of the Tablet Puzzle

abstract: Amazon announces a 46 percent jump in sales in the first quarter, led by sales of electronics and other general merchandise.
snippet: Amazon announces a 46 percent jump in sales in the first quarter, led by sales of electronics and other general merchandise.
lead_paragraph: Amazon.com is still known by many consumers primarily for selling books, music and DVDs, even though it also offers a ridiculous variation of other products, like HDTVs, patio furniture and replicas of human fat.

headline.main: Amazon Now a Larger Seller of Stuff Other Than Media
